missionProperties.missionDescription: If playing a mini campaign, heroes must bring a Spectre ally that they have not brought to a mission during this mini campaign. ==== Thanks to the reconnaissance the Spectres performed on Geonosis, the Rebellion sees an opportunity to salvage an old battle droid factory on the planet and turn these Clone Wars soldiers against the might of the Empire. A member of Spectre group will meet you at the side.
missionProperties.additionalMissionInfo: If playing a mini campaign, heroes must bring a Spectre ally that they have not brought to a mission during this mini campaign.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

events.eventText:
You've scavenged the dead factory thoroughly when your pilot's voice comes over the comlink. “Imperials headed your way! I'm coming in to pick you up at the rendezvous coordinates.” Suddenly, you hear the factory’s security systems flicker to life, blast doors closing in the distance.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} The door is locked.
{-} When a hero withdraws, they are incapacitated instead. When activating, they receive only 1 action and can only use that action to perform a move.

eventActions.tbText: The doors are controlled by a trio of security terminals strewn throughout the factory.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
One of the terminals controlling the factory's security system.

{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to try and claim the terminal ({I} or {J}). If unsuccessful, discard the terminal.

One of the terminals controlling the factory's security system.

{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to try and claim the terminal ({I} or {J}). If unsuccessful, discard the terminal.

One of the terminals controlling the factory's security system.

{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to try and claim the terminal ({I} or {J}). If unsuccessful, discard the terminal.

eventActions.tbText:
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to try and claim the terminal ({I} or {J}). If unsuccessful, discard the terminal.
{-} The door unlocks when all terminals have been claimed or discarded.
A couple of old, dilapitaded battle droids stands around, not having moved for years.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The old, dilapidated battle droid is covered with fine dust.
The old, dilapidated battle droid is covered with fine dust.
The old, dilapidated battle droid is covered with fine dust.

eventActions.tbText: {-} The neutral mission tokens represent deactivated battle droids.

You draw your weapons, ready to fight your way out.

{-} The mission will progress when all terminals have been claimed or discarded.
{-} The Rebels lose when not all heroes are on the Extraction Zone at the end of Round 6, or when all heroes are wounded. (If the round limit is disabled, the heroes can be extracted at the end of later rounds.)

eventActions.theText:
{-} The door is locked. It opens when all terminals have been claimed or discarded.
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to try and claim the terminal ({I} or {J}). If unsuccessful, discard the terminal.
{-} When a hero withdraws, they are incapacitated instead. When activating, they receive only 1 action and can only use that action to perform a move.
{-} The mission will progress when all terminals have been claimed or discarded.
{-} The Rebels lose when not all heroes are on the Extraction Zone at the end of Round 6, or when all heroes are wounded. (If the round limit is disabled, the heroes can be extracted at the end of later rounds.)

events.eventText:
“Ready to go! Get on or get left!” your pilot shouts over the roar of your ship’s engines. You hustle aboard, keeping the gear you've scavenged close.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} If playing as a side mission, heroes receive 1 Spectre ally of their choice as an ally.

eventActions.mainText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
You narrowly escape through the factory’s garbage chute into the surrounding wasteland. Hopefully, another shuttle won't take too long to arrive. 

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.

eventActions.mainText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
Your ship kicks into the air as Imperial soldiers pepper it with blaster fire. Below, you see stormtroopers exchanging fire with battle droids. The Empire will have to throw a lot of resources at clearing them all out — resources that won't be pointed at the Rebellion.

You meet the Ghost a few days later. “The Empire has sent more troops to smash those droids into dust,” Sabine tells you. “Better them than us.”

{-} Each hero receives 3 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.
{-} Rebel players choose 1 hero to receive the “Tech Specialist” Reward card.

eventActions.mainText:
Please select the correct option below.

{-} Extended campaign: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with the Thrawn Villain Pack.
{-} Mini campaign: I'm playing the regular "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign without any packs.

events.eventText:
You watch your ship thrust toward orbit, pursued by a pair of TIE fighters, as you slide down among the crags of the Geonosian landscape. Stormtroopers swarm the area. By nightfall, you've sheltered within the wreckage of a Trade Federation battleship for a frigid night.

Your ship returns in the morning. You still look pretty rough at your next rendezvous. "You look like you've come out the wrong end of a krykna hive," says Zeb.

{-} Each hero receives 3 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.

eventActions.mainText:
Please select the correct option below.

{-} Extended campaign: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with the Thrawn Villain Pack.
{-} Mini campaign: I'm playing the regular "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign without any packs.

events.eventText:
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

Thrawn has been tracking you closely ever since you joined up with the Spectres. You are certain that you haven't given away the Spectres’ location, but it’s starting to become a real problem. One that needs solving if you want to stay ahead of Thrawn.

Your contact on Lothal, N-4M, has good news. “I have purchased certain Imperial clearance codes,” the droid says. “I believe it will give you access to one particular location: the secondary docking bay of the Star Destroyer Chimaera.” N-4M doesn't need to explain how you can tse this information. Thrawn’s infiltrator droids are all controlled from his flagship. A surgical strike at its heart could give you just the breathing room you need.

{-} The next active mission is “The Admiral’s Grip” (Thrawn Villain Pack).

You hear the heated debate in the Ghost's common room well before you see it. "This could be our best chance to take the fight to Thrawn", insists Ezra, gesturing toward a holographic depiction of Lothal, complete with several Star Destroyers in orbit. "I know this might be a trap, but what if it isn't? We've been working hard to find an opening to strike back at Thrawn."

You interrupt to ask what's going on.

"An Imperial engineer got us a message", says Kanan. "He wants to defect, and he says he can get us into the datavault containing everything Thrawn's infiltrator droids have gathered." You have to simply imagine the significant look on Kanan's face as the mask tilts in your direction. "Information that gives him an edge on the Rebellion. But someone just letting us in? It sounds too good to be true."

"We'd never even get to the ground with Thrawn's goons everywhere", says Zeb. "Every Imperial in the sector probably knows what we look like."

You step forward. The Spectres are important to the Rebellion. They can't afford to take the chance. But you can.

{-} The next active mission is “The Final Order”.

eventActions.mainText:
You start to slice into the terminal.

{-} Test {J} or {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the terminal, then discard all strain tokens on the terminal. Enter the number of successes below.

events.eventText:
You fail to slice the terminal, so you destroy it to unlock the door.

{-} Discard this terminal.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
One of the terminals controlling the factory's security system.

{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to try and claim the terminal ({I} or {J}). If unsuccessful, discard the terminal.

eventActions.tbText:
Now that the terminal is gone, one of the old battle droids is truly useless.

{-} Discard the red battle droid.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The old, dilapidated battle droid is covered with fine dust.

events.eventText:
You manage to slice the terminal. You deactivate this part of the door lock, then take over control.

{-} Claim the terminal.

eventActions.tbText:
A nearby battle droid, dormant for decades, whirrs to life. It raises a rusted blaster rifle and looks to you expectantly.

{-} Once during their activation, a hero can command the red battle droid. That hero may push the battle droid up to 3 spaces. Then, they may choose a figure within 3 spaces and in line of sight of the battle droid and roll 1 blue die. That figure suffers {H} equal to the {H}  results. Each battle droid can be commanded once per round.

eventActions.abilities: BATTLE DROID: Once during their activation, a hero can command the blue battle droid. That hero may push the battle droid up to 3 spaces. Then, they may choose a figure within 3 spaces and in line of sight of the battle droid and roll 1 blue die. That figure suffers {H} equal to the {H}  results. Each battle droid can be commanded once per round.

eventActions.theText:
{-} The door is locked. It opens when all terminals have been claimed or discarded.
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to try and claim the terminal ({I} or {J}). If unsuccessful, discard the terminal.
{-} Once during their activation, a hero can command a battle droid matching the color of a claimed terminal. That hero may push the battle droid up to 3 spaces. Then, they may choose a figure within 3 spaces and in line of sight of the battle droid and roll 1 blue die. That figure suffers {H} equal to the {H}  results. Each battle droid can be commanded once per round.
{-} When a hero withdraws, they are incapacitated instead. When activating, they receive only 1 action and can only use that action to perform a move.
{-} The mission will progress when all terminals have been claimed or discarded.
{-} The Rebels lose when not all heroes are on the Extraction Zone at the end of Round 6, or when all heroes are wounded. (If the round limit is disabled, the heroes can be extracted at the end of later rounds.)

events.eventText: As you make your way through the facility, suddenly a familiar figure appears from the shadows. "Hello, hello, my friends!", Hondo Ohnaka says. "I am very sorry that we crossed paths again, but maybe we can work something out?" He raises his blaster.

As you make your way through the facility, your eyes fall upon a blue-skinned man in an impeccable white uniform. "Ah. How predictable of you to fall for my traps. Again.", Thrawn says. "Now it is time to end this sad spectacle." He draws his blaster.
Alarms blare through the factory.
Alarms blare through the factory.
The door slides open to reveal the dusty wasteland of Geonosis. The coordinates for your extraction point are nearby.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The door out of the droid factory is locked tight.

{-} The door opens when all terminals have been claimed or discarded.

eventActions.tbText:
{-} The green highlighted spaces are the Extraction Zone.
{-} The mission ends at the end of Round 6. At this time, if all heroes are on the Extraction Zone (green highlight), the heroes depart, winning the mission. (If the round limit is disabled, the heroes can be extracted at the end of later rounds.)

eventActions.repositionText: Block access to the Extraction Zone.

eventActions.shortText: Get to the Extraction Zone and hold your ground until the end of Round 6.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Once during their activation, a hero can command a battle droid matching the color of a claimed terminal. That hero may push the battle droid up to 3 spaces. Then, they may choose a figure within 3 spaces and in line of sight of the battle droid and roll 1 blue die. That figure suffers {H} equal to the {H}  results. Each battle droid can be commanded once per round.
{-} When a hero withdraws, they are incapacitated instead. When activating, they receive only 1 action and can only use that action to perform a move.
{-} The mission ends at the end of Round 6. At this time, if all heroes are on the Extraction Zone (green highlight), the heroes depart, winning the mission.  (If the round limit is disabled, the heroes can be extracted at the end of later rounds.)
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText: Enemies are already waiting for you.
